ab.title: Genesis 28
ab.l: AndIsaac called Jacob, and blessed him and commanded him, andhe said to him, ‘You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
Arise,go to Paddan-Aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father,and take you a wife from there of the daughters of Laban, the brotherof your mother.
And may the mighty God bless you and spreadyou and multiply you, that you may become a multitude of people.
And may he give the blessing of Abraham to youand to your offspring with you, that you may inherit the land of your sojourningthat God gave to Abraham!’
And Isaacsent Jacob, and he went to Paddan-Aram to Laban, sonof Bethuel, the Aramean, brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacoband Esau.

And Esau saw that Isaac had blessedJacob, and sent him to Paddan-Aram, to take him from therea wife when he blessed him, and he had commanded him, saying,‘You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.’
And Jacob listened to the words of his father and his mother, and wentto Paddan-Aram.
And Esau saw thatthe daughters of Canaan seemed not good in the eyes of Isaac, his father.
And went Esau to Ishmael, and took Mahalath, daughterof Ishmael, son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth,besides the wives whom he had, as a wife for him.Parashat Vayetze
And Jacob went out fromBeersheba, and went toward Haran.
Andhe reached a place, and stayed the night there, because the sun had set. Andhe took one of the stones of that place, and he put it under his head,and lay down in that place.
And he dreamed.And, lo: a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reachesto heaven. And, lo, the angels of God ascend anddescend on it.

And, lo, the divine Presenceof the Lord stands above it, and said, ‘I am the Lord Godof Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The land on whichyou are lying: I will give it to you and to your offspring.
And your offspring will be like the dust of the earth,and you will spread to the west, and to the east, and to the north,and to the south. And in you will all the familiesof the earth be blessed.
And, lo,my help is with you, and I will keep you everywhereyou go, and I will bring you back to this land. For I will not leave you,until I have done that which I have spokento you of.’

And Jacob awoke from his sleep, andhe said, ‘Surely, the divine Presence of Lord is in this place,and I did not know.’ And he was afraid, and said, ‘Howawesome is this place! This is none other but the houseof God, and this is the gate of heaven.’
AndJacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stonethat he had put under his head, and set it up for a pillar, and pouredoil on the top of it.
And he called the name of thatplace Bethel, though in truth the name of that city was called Luzat first.
And Jacob vowed a vow, saying,‘If God’s help will be with me and will keepme in this way that I go and will give me breadto eat, and clothing to put on,
And I come backto my father’s house in peace, then the Lord will become God to me.

And this stone that I have set for a pillar will befor God’s house, seg type="commented" n="#seg014"/to compose my prayers and paymy vowsanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg014"/, and of everything that you will give meI will surely give the tenth to you.
